verse: In the first year Cyrus was king of Persia [539 bc], the Lord ·caused [stirred up the spirit of] Cyrus to send an announcement to his whole kingdom and to put it in writing. This happened so the Lord’s ·message [prophecy; word] ·spoken by [by the mouth of] Jeremiah would ·come true [be fulfilled]. He wrote:
This is what Cyrus king of Persia says:

Then the ·family [clan] leaders of Judah and Benjamin and the priests and Levites ·got ready [arose] to go to Jerusalem—everyone ·God had caused to want [whose spirit/heart/mind God had stirred] to go to Jerusalem to ·build [or rebuild] the ·Temple [house] of the Lord.

All their neighbors ·helped them [encouraged/assisted/aided them; strengthened their hands], giving them things made of silver and gold, along with ·supplies [goods], ·cattle [livestock], valuable gifts, and ·special gifts [voluntary/freewill offerings].

Also, King Cyrus brought out the ·bowls and pans [articles] that belonged in the ·Temple [house] of the Lord, which Nebuchadnezzar had ·taken [carried away] from Jerusalem and put in the ·temple [house] of his own ·god [gods; Dan. 1:2; 5:1–4].
Cyrus king of Persia had Mithredath the treasurer bring them and count them out ·for [to] Sheshbazzar, the ·prince [leader of the exiles] of Judah.
He listed thirty gold dishes, one thousand silver dishes, twenty-nine ·pans [or knives; or utensils],
thirty gold bowls, four hundred ten matching silver bowls, and one thousand other pieces.
There was a total of fifty-four hundred ·pieces [articles; vessels] of gold and silver. Sheshbazzar brought all these things along when the ·captives [exiles] went from Babylon to Jerusalem.
